question: If I wanted to build a telescope that could see the rings of Saturn from my backyard, what specifications would it need?

steps.content: If I wanted to build a telescope that could see the rings of Saturn from my backyard, what specifications would it need?
Plan: 1) Search for the minimum telescope specifications needed to see the rings of Saturn. 2) Return the specifications.
Searching for the minimum telescope specifications to see the rings of Saturn.
To see the rings of Saturn from your backyard, you would need a telescope with at least a 4-inch (100mm) aperture and a magnification of 50x or more.
To see the rings of Saturn from your backyard, you would need a telescope with at least a 4-inch (100mm) aperture and a magnification of 50x or more.

true_answer: To see the rings of Saturn from your backyard, you would need a telescope with at least a 4-inch (100mm) aperture and a magnification of 50x or more.
